New Records: Andrew Wiggins scored a game-high 29 points and made a game-best five 3-pointers
The Golden State Warriors were outscored by 20 points in the paint (58-38)
Andrew Wiggins scored at least nine points in three different quarters, including shooting a perfect 4-for-4 in the third quarter and his highest-scoring 11-point fourth quarter on 4-for-5 shooting
Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Clippers went on an 11-0 run in the second quarter
Buddy Hield hit a baseline jumper for his first home basket at Chase Center
Buddy Hield made a deep three despite being fouled and fell into the front row of Dub Nation fans
Buddy Hield converted the 4-point play and found Trayce Jackson-Davis for an alley-oop slam
Andrew Wiggins was tasked with being the primary defender on James Harden
Kevon Looney recorded a double-double off the bench with 10 points and 11 rebounds
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Curry hurt his left ankle late in the third quarter and re-injured the same ankle early in the fourth quarter, forcing him to be sidelined for the remainder of the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors will host the New Orleans Pelicans for a home back-to-back on Tuesday and Wednesday
